text: -This is the greatest. I love you. -Mmm.
I love you too.
-Good morning. -Hi.
-You like me! -[laughs]
-I'm all-in, and I love you. [chuckles] -I love you too, Tiffany.
[Tiffany laughing] Oh!
Bliss, you're everything that I've been looking for my entire life.
Will you marry me?
Yeah.
I'm engaged to Zack.
[chuckles] I feel like I knew that he was my person, deep in my soul.
You know, you know.
I love you a lot, but I'm still gonna have concern of being second choice.
I need time.
I'm not sacrificing what I want, but I am compromising.
Welcome to marriage.
-Okay. -Do you wanna settle down?
[Shelby] You're meant to have the best wedding of your life.
But this isn't it.
This isn't it.
You didn't wanna sit here and talk. You were like, "I'm leaving."
What else am I to do?
Sit in my feelings and sleep next to someone
who said I was not man enough for them?
We don't have sex.
It is weird to see somebody that you truly care about with somebody else.
["Got My Eyes on You" playing]
-You too cool for school. -You were talking to MBA cry boy.
If you truly think you're gonna go walk up and talk to Marshall
and be like, "Yo, I do," then fuck it.
But if you don't feel like heart-to-heart
you're really gonna marry Marshall, pick me.
♪ I've got my eyes on you ♪
-[pop music playing] {\an8}-♪ Won't find another quite like me ♪
{\an8}♪ I don't just want it I've got this need ♪
{\an8}I'm just glad everybody loved my shoes. That's all that matters.
{\an8}[Marshall] Mm-hmm.
[door lock beeping]
I love Jackie.
I've never been so certain about anything in my entire life.
And there was never a doubt in my mind.
Jackie and I were designed for each other.
And so, to be where we are now,
I'm shocked. I'm stunned.
{\an8}And it hurts.
{\an8}[sniffles]
How do I go from being so sure about something, so certain
about anything that I've ever done in my life to being so uncertain
and unclear?
[sighs]
You need something to drink? Water?
[Jackelina] Yeah. I need a water, for sure.
I'm tired.
I had a long-ass day.
How are you feeling?
[Marshall] Seeing everyone else tonight…
I need you to lay it out for me plain.
What do you need from me, what do you require from me,
so that I know, moving forward. That's it.
Oh, my God.
[gasps] I can't talk about this anymore.
My brain is shot, Marshall.
Like, it's almost midnight.
Can we talk about this tomorrow?
If-- If that's--
If that's what you-- If that's what you want.
You're doing great. I don't expect anything from you.
I think that you're doing just fine.
I was left with a big question mark.
From me?
Or internally because you have that question mark?
From you.
I thought we were fine. I thought we ended up fine.
-You got some pretty eyes on you. -Hmm?
-You got some pretty eyes on you. -Thank you.
Brett gave me advice tonight that I didn't know that I needed.
It's time to protect…
my feelings and not… not sugarcoat or change anything
based off of how-- how you're feeling anymore.
Totally valid.
Just tell me exactly what you need from me,
so I'm not guessing through the night and guessing when we wake up,
because you leave before I even start my day.
But I always come back home.
But that does not mean that I'm not thinking about it throughout the day.
I had an emotional day.
I'm having emotional conversations with people
that I don't even know what the fuck is going on.
[laughs] And I'm just like, I just wanna go to bed.
I'm tired just as much as you are.
I gotta go into the office tomorrow. I gotta go to Redmond.
-We good! -We're not good.
I need to know exactly what you require from me so I can move forward.
What I told you, what I required from you, is the reason why you left.
-But-- -I'm not saying that shit again.
Okay, so what are the examples though?
[gasps] I can't give no examples at no midnight, bro.
Marshall.
I think you are a great guy. I think you're so sweet.
Just love me.
Just love me.

[vocalizing]
{\an8}♪ Never give up ♪
{\an8}♪ Just never give up ♪
{\an8}♪ Never give up ♪

{\an8}[laughing]

{\an8}[Zack] It's one thing for me
{\an8}to kind of tell Bliss a little bit about how I grew up
{\an8}and where I came from,
{\an8}but I think it's a little bit different when she meets my family.
They're important to me, and she's important to me.
I think when it's all over, when we're laying on our deathbeds,
family is really all you got.
{\an8}When was this one?
{\an8}-[woman] Zack and our mom at her wedding. -[Bliss] Aww!
Oh, look how cute!
-Law school graduation, yeah. -[women laughing]
[Bliss] You look so happy. You're like, "Yes, I'm done studying."
-[Zack] That's exactly how I felt. -[all laughing]
[Bliss] It's so lovely that you guys came here to support him.
That really means a lot.
-It's true. -[woman] What made him stand out?
{\an8}-[laughing] Where do I begin? -I mean, I know, probably.
{\an8}But, like, I wanna know.
{\an8}You know, gosh, it was so many different things.
{\an8}Obviously, he's super smart.
{\an8}He's just, like, so giving too.
He just really inspires me.
There's a lot of strength in someone to be able to, like,
{\an8}choose to, you know,
{\an8}do certain things when it'd be easier to maybe go a different way.
{\an8}And my dad kind of has a similar kind of childhood and stuff.
And he also chose different paths, and it's not easy to do that.
So, I just really deeply, like, admire him.
[Becky] He could have went down many different roads,
and he only chose the up road, always, and put everybody before himself.
And… super proud. [chuckles]
{\an8}[Bliss] Yeah, and I think in those moments of really hard times,
{\an8}like, that's when your true character comes out.
Like, who you really are.
And so, yeah, I think he just was also really just open about things,
and he's very, like, honest, and I just feel like I can really trust him.
I take, like, marriage very seriously and, like, commitment very seriously.
I think when people say like,
{\an8}"If it feels right, you know, then it's right."
To truly, like, feel like you can be yourself with someone
in your full capacity is, like, so amazing.
And I've never had that experience before.
It's-- Yeah, I just really… I love him. And I respect him as a person.
And yeah, I've never met anyone like him.
-I like her. -I like her too.
-You guys fit together really good. -Yeah.
[Becky] Seeing you guys, you could just see in his eyes.
-Like, his eyes tell it all. -[all laughing]
You look really happy.
Yeah.

{\an8}[Chelsea] Very in.
{\an8}-What is that? -This.
That?
[Chelsea] I really like these pants a lot.
{\an8}I'm gonna get both. These.
[Kwame sighs, clears throat]
Oh, I wanted to try the biker shorts too.
Baby, you have 10,000 things back there.
-You wanna go--? -Kwame, for as much as you like clothes…
-The biker shorts, you should do. -[Chelsea] Definitely.
Perfect.
When we woke up this morning, first thing I said to Chelsea was,
"Hey, are you okay? How are you doing?" You know?
And her response to me was, "Do I sound okay? Or do I look okay?"
Almost in a really confrontational way.
And it kind of hit me in a weird way,
'cause that is something that she's done a couple times.
I'm trying to do the good thing, and then all of a sudden it feels like
I'm the bad guy, or I'm the one who screwed up her morning,
and it just like…
It was just hard.
-Okay. -No, they look good.
I think I might have one more.
Okay. Go ahead. Do your thing.
[laughs] Do you think it could possibly get any hotter in here?
[both laugh]
Yes or no?
-Nope. -Yeah.
-I'm having so much fun with you. -Are you?
-Yeah. -Good. [chuckles]
All right, see ya.
See ya.
We're getting into the last stretch,
and I'm going through a lot.
Trying to find moments where I could be by myself,
but wherever I am, I'm in her space.
Just like, in certain points, it can feel suffocating.
You know?
That's a tough look.
Just say "you're beautiful," you know.
-What's up? -"Tough look." Don't know what that means.
-It means it's a good look. -I like it.
I like the sling.
Next time, I'll just say, "You're beautiful."
-I'm sorry. You know? -[laughing] I'm just joking.
Complimenting you the only way I know how.
It's okay. Wait, wait.
-Okay. -We are not done with those strawberries.
-My man. -All right, bet. [exhales]
-Okay, you gonna feed me a strawberry? -[chuckles] Yeah.
Tell me how much you love me.
[laughing]
-Come on. -Good.
[both laughing]
Want me to feed you one?
I've eaten enough of these, baby. I'm good.
-Mnh-mnh. -Okay.
You've already had one of these? You haven't.
-No, I've-- [laughs] -Oh, you did?
What you think I've been doing every time you change?
-Oh, I'm sorry. -[laughing]
-It's okay. -That's right.
Why do I have to wait a week? [chuckles]
-I feel that. -I just wanna do it.
But if we have to come down to Earth for a moment, like,
today was a really, really tough morning for us.
-And-- Stop smiling. [laughs] -[laughing] I'm sorry.
Can't take you seriously.
Well, I'm trying to be real with you for a sec.
I know. I feel you. I'm sorry. I don't know why I'm smiling.
-I don't know why you're smiling. -You're hella cute.
I can't look at your face. [chuckles]
-[laughs] Okay, okay. I'm serious. -Okay. So…
All right. So…
-This morning, we wake up. -[clears throat]
You're not feeling great.
Obviously, I know you're not feeling great.
So I ask you, "Hey, how are you feeling?"
"Are you okay?"
-What was your response to me? -I don't know.
Your response was, "Do I sound okay?"
[scoffs] You tell me if that sounds fair to you.
You're not considering the weight of things you're saying.
Like, "Fuck it. I'm gonna say it."
I never directed it at you.
And it's the stress that we're under that's frustrating me.
I wanted to help you out. There's no need--
This is "throw Chelsea under the bus," then I'm gonna throw you under.
-So you better get ready. -Go ahead. Please, do it.
-Do it. -It does not seem nice.
It does not seem considerate.
I understand the things, but you don't have to, like, nitpick every little thing.
I'm not nitpicking. I'm telling you how you approach things.
How you go after conversations.
How you always wanna, like, chase the fight.
It always just feels like everything's so confrontational, dude.
Everything's so confrontational.
I'm just direct.
I'm just open. I don't like to, like, keep things in and harbor it and, like…
I-- I just don't do that.
Big difference between being direct and being confrontational, baby.
"Do I look or do I sound okay?"
Like, that's not being direct.
-That's being confrontational. -I just--
[Kwame sighs]
I'm trying.
-I'm trying, dude. -I know you are.
There's no pocket of this moment
in which I can, like, just go hide away and have my little peace.
There's no pockets for me.
You have pockets.
If you're stressed, you can hang with Mom. That brings you back.
You can go hang out with Rocky.
All those things help you get back to yourself.
I have nothing here that helps me get back to myself.
Nothing.
What, I'm gonna drive to Portland for three hours,
and then go lay in my bed and take a deep breath and then come back?
[chuckles] Okay.
I wish you could do that.
It's just tough because thinking about, like,
literally, like, fuck everything that I say that I'm giving up.
Fuck everything that I say I'm giving up. Fuck Portland. Forget that.
I can put all those things aside because you would make up
for more than enough happiness in that.
But in the last couple of days, it's been tough. It's been stress.
Yeah, it has.
[Kwame] And this is the time when we're supposed to have each other's back.
♪ Realizing that I'll never See you that way again ♪
♪ Time's ticking But we're not getting stronger ♪
♪ Stronger… ♪
I know we're going to fight, argue. I know we're gonna have tough moments.
♪ Were we just a losing game… ♪
But, like, I just want us to be each other's peace. That's all.
That's what I need from you, and right now, we're just not having that.
We are gonna have to stand there at that altar and trust each other deeply
that we're willing to do this and figure it out.
Every single day.
We're not changing who we are.
I love you for who you are, and I do believe you love me for who I am.
I do. I do.
But, I mean, obviously, big day coming up.
Do you see yourself standing there at that altar, being able to say, "Yes"?
Baby. Baby. Baby.
Do you see yourself do it though?
I do. If I didn't, I wouldn't still be in this experiment.

{\an8}[man] We've heard good things about you, so we're excited to meet you in person.
-Okay. [laughs] -Yeah.
{\an8}Brett calls me up, and he tells me,
{\an8}"I found my love, and I'm getting married."
{\an8}I'm like, "What?"
{\an8}You disappear for a month. You come back, and you're engaged.
What was it?
What was the deciding factor that was like, "Okay, I'm gonna do this"?
'Cause that's a big jump.
There have been so many times in, like, dating where I never really felt
that the women I'm talking to have ever really,
like, really sat down and, like, understood me.
And then not just understood it, but then wanted to take it and say,
"I wanna support you,
and I wanna continue to, like, help you be a better person."
{\an8}[Tiffany] With Brett, I felt like I could talk to him about anything.
Like values and family, finances, history.
He just lets me be me.
Because I feel like I've dated a lot of people.
I just kind of knew what I was looking for.
I needed someone that understands struggle,
but doesn't get complacent with their life,
is always trying to do something better, do something more.
Um, and that's what I saw in him.
I'm the type of person that's going to continue to, like, push myself.
And I need a man that's the same way.
-[Lakayana] That's that dude. For sure. -[Tiffany] Yes!
The more that we started talking, the more that I realized
just, like, how genuine and, like, loving and caring of a person that she is.
And then as we started talking about, like, family,
{\an8}that was something that was really important to me.
{\an8}'Cause I've definitely dated girls before that when it comes to family, like,
women see me now, and they don't see where I come from.
And when they see where I come from, there's, like, judgment for my family
and kind of decisions that they made and things that they've done.
So, it's, like, if I'm gonna bring somebody into my life,
like, this person needs to understand that.
And above all, like, support it. Right?
And, like, that's all I ever got from her.
Just kind of told her all I was feeling,
and just for me, it was really like letting my guard down.
Like, I'm really seeing a future with you,
and so many things that, I guess, I've been afraid of,
that I wasn't even aware that I've been afraid of
until, like, you came, and I got to know you.
So anyway, I'm trying not to get too emotional talking about that.
But, um, thinking about, like, a family
and, like, kind of starting a new branch in my family, you know,
with, like, where she is in her life, where I'm at with my life.
Our ambition, you know, Black women and you know.
-It's important. -[Brett] It is.
And it's like, you know, generational poverty in my family is a thing.
And it's like, I wanna be with somebody
that is, like, driven and focused as I am.
And we can grow together, and we can start a whole new, like, life
for when it comes to our kids and what they can be able to achieve
and give them the resources I didn't have.
[Tiffany] Hmm.
-[laughing] -She's amazing. She's absolutely amazing.
[Ralen] Could we cheers to that one too? Jeez, wow.
-[laughing] -[Ralen] The first one was…
-[Lakayana] Oh, my God. -[Tiffany] Whoo!
-Oh, my gosh. -[Wilson] Cheers.
It's really dope. It feels like… sounds like real love,
and so I'm very happy for you.
I'm pretty… confident.
I've observed how you look at Brett, and, Brett,
I've looked at how you look at Tiffany, and it is a very beautiful thing.
Um, and words are part of it,
but actions speak louder than that.
The way y'all look at each other has been very inspiring.
And to see a Black couple is a beautiful thing.
Yo. Y'all are gonna make me cry. [laughs]
-We'll have to cheers to that as well. -Happy tears. [laughs]

♪ If I could, I would for you ♪
♪ Change it all for you ♪
{\an8}♪ Would give it all to you ♪

{\an8}-Oh, my God. Thank you! -Some flowers.
{\an8}You're so cute. These are so pretty.

{\an8}As we get closer, it gets more serious. It gets more real.
We've been dealing with a lot of new variables, like new people.
Seeing our family members, our friends.
It's a little challenging, to say the least.
This is really cute. I've never been down here.
I haven't either.
But I know that I love her, and I want Micah to know how I'm feeling.
{\an8}I'm excited for your mom to be back here, kinda. [laughs]
-Yeah. -I love her. She's been texting me.
-Oh, no. -She's trying to get all the info.
-Oh, really? -Yeah.
What's she saying?
She just wants my, like, opinion on, like, her dress for the wedding.
She wants to know what my mom's wearing.
-Salad bowl? -Yeah.
-Uh-oh. -[server] Uh-oh.
-Gravity. -[Paul] All good.
-Thank you. -[server] Cornichons, anchovies.
[Micah] I feel like we're giving ourselves as much time as possible
before, like, being completely, like, certain. I feel like that's good.
I feel like it just shows that we, like, actually wanna make the right decision.
It is 100% smart.
But it also gives me an incredible amount of anxiety.
[Micah laughs] Yeah.
If we, like, were to get married,
I don't know if my stuff would fit into your, like, life. [laughs]
We need a bigger spot?
Yeah. [chuckles]
My place is pretty empty. Or did you think the opposite?
I mean, there's no closets or anything.
It's also difficult 'cause, like, all my stuff's in Scottsdale.
I feel like you wanna keep your place in Scottsdale.
We could leave a lot of that stuff there and, like, bring, like, some essentials.
I'm thinking, like, clothes and, like, shoes and stuff.
[laughs] How much more clothes do you have? 'Cause like--
What do you mean?
It's so much already at the townhouse.
[laughs]
That's probably, like, less than, like, a 40th of what I have.
I think that what we should do is get a three-bedroom
and dedicate a whole room to your clothes, okay?
[Micah] There you go.
-[laughs] -Right.
Would you wanna, like, do long distance from me?
Definitely not. I think that sucks.
Would you wanna come with me to Scottsdale?
No.
-Well-- [scoffs] -But I would. I would.
If I can get my job to go fully remote, I would definitely come with you there.
I wouldn't move there, but…
You know what? I won't even say that much. I'll go in with an open mind
with the possibility that I would move there.
I could probably be convinced.
I wouldn't want you to be not happy.
I think it's just important to me that you're willing to try.
-[Paul] Yeah. And I can do that. -See what--
If we don't get married, like, what would we do?
I feel like it'd be hard to, like, go back to living, like, separately.
Yeah, it definitely would.
I think it would be very lonely for me.
Like, I don't want that. Of course not. Like, I love you.
-I don't want that. -I love you too.
You make me want to be my best self. And that is such a cool feeling,
because I haven't been, like,
that inspired or motivated in, like, several years
by, like, a girl or anybody, really.
That's something that I knew that I was missing in my life.
You're the thing that I'm the most attracted to on Earth right now.
So, like, I would be lying if I said that I wasn't afraid of losing you.

♪ And stay here ♪
♪ I'm so sick of my head aching ♪
{\an8}[Bliss] I'm excited for you to meet my mom and my sisters.
{\an8}[Zack] Yeah.
{\an8}[Bliss] Are you excited?
{\an8}[Zack] Yeah.
{\an8}[chuckles] That's all you're gonna give me? You're so nervous.
-[Bliss laughs] Hi, baby! -You look so cute.
{\an8}Hi, Zack.
{\an8}-[Zack] Hi. -It's nice to meet you.
{\an8}[Zack] What was your name?
{\an8}-Annalee. -[Zack] Annalee. And?
{\an8}-Tatiana. -[Zack] Tatiana.
{\an8}-Yes, nice to meet you. -[Zack] Nice to meet you.
{\an8}So, Bliss's mom just flew out from Arizona.
{\an8}-Hey. -[mom] Hey, nice to meet you.
{\an8}[Bliss] Oh, you're already crying?
{\an8}Okay, Mom. [chuckles]
It's important to me that if we get married
that I have a good relationship with her family,
and so I'm a little nervous.
I told Bliss that. Bliss is like,
"You don't have anything to be nervous about," but… [groans]
I'm a little nervous about it.
[Bliss] You guys wanna see my ring?
-[Katherine] Yes. -[Tatiana] Beautiful.
So, can you guys tell us, like, a little bit about your journey,
like, up to this point?
Yeah. So, we met on a social experiment. Psychological experiment?
-I don't know how you classify it. -Both.
Where you're not able to see the other person.
[chuckles] I'm having, like, a weird déjà vu moment
in this moment.
Just keep going. You are the one that has to tell the story.
Yeah. Um, Bliss and I really clicked
when she started talking to me about books.
Then I realized how smart and intelligent she was.
And that's what really attracted me to her.
And she is brilliant. She's beautiful.
She is driven, and she's fierce.
-That's right. Watch out, buddy. -[Zack] She's thoughtful.
Um, I mean, there's not many women who dream of being on the moon at age 60.
When I look at who she is, I don't think there's anyone else
that I could make a bigger impact in the world with by my side.
And getting to know her character has been really impressive.
[laughing] Okay, everyone.
-[Katherine] Wow. -[Bliss] That's sweet.
[chuckles] It's all because of my mom. Seriously, though.
Thank you.
I'm glad that you realize her worth because she is…
-Here I said I wasn't gonna cry. -[Bliss] You're gonna make me cry now.
She is worth more than gold.
She is, like, one of the most important people in my life.
And that is what I want for her.
I want somebody who's gonna know what her worth is
and treat her with the respect that she deserves.
And because she is our princess.
She's our princess.
I hadn't told a woman that I loved them
since I was, like, 21.
Why was that? Why is that?
Uh, it's hard for me to say.
I think, ordinarily, I'm not a very vulnerable person,
but I knew going into the experiment
that if I wanted to be serious about it,
I was gonna have to be vulnerable with, not just one person,
but a lot of different people. And the downside to being vulnerable
with… multiple people is that, uh,
sometimes you can get feelings for more than one person at the same time.
I ended up in a situation where I had to choose between two girls
that I'd never actually met.
-And-- -You're just telling them everything.
-I might as well, right? -[Bliss] You can.
[Zack] I don't know. I mean…
I can see even talking about it makes Bliss uncomfortable.
-So it's really awkward talking. -That's okay.
[Katherine] Yeah, we wanna know.
-Go ahead. -Keep-- Keep going.
Keep going.
[Zack] Um, so, I ended up having feelings
for two different women at the same time.
I never, ever wanted to be in that situation.
There was all this uncertainty.
You know, I talked with Bliss about, um,
whether I was gonna fit in with your family.
I really didn't know if it would work when we got into the real world.
None of us did. That's the whole point is to experiment.
[Zack] Yeah.
And, um,
yeah, I made the wrong decision.
[sighs] I ended up realizing that the person I had proposed to
was there for the wrong reasons.
And so I called it off.
-[Annalee] So… -Well-- Oh.
Yeah, go ahead and ask him questions. Feel free to be a little mean.
Throw some wine in his face, you know. He might deserve it.
-Can we go talk for a minute? -[Bliss laughs]
So, what makes you sure about Bliss
now, that you wanna be with her?
Because, you know, her family is a big part of her life.
And you said something about, you know,
you weren't sure if you were gonna fit in and all that.
So, I mean, can you elaborate on that a little bit more?
So, the way I grew up, um,
I mean, I grew up in poverty. I grew up in… uh, with not much stability.
I literally had to teach myself most everything.
I mean, my mom gave me unconditional love.
And, uh, my mom has passed away, so she's not around anymore.
But I've been in relationships in the past
with women who came from very well-to-do families,
where I was definitely not accepted by their family because of how I grew up.
I think that is what really made me nervous
is, like, hearing about how your family is.
So, when I talked about, like, my fear about not being accepted… it's that.
-Romeo and Juliet didn't work out, right? -Right.
